com.siemens.icm.io
Interface ADCListener

public interface ADCListener

The ADCListener interface defines the capabilities for receiving measured values from the ADC hardware interfaces. When the user wants to receive these values, an implementation class for ADCListener interface must be created first.
The adcValues method of this class must contain the processing code for the adc voltage values. This code shall leave the listener context as soon as possible (i.e. running a new thread). While the callback method does not return it cannot be called again if new values are available, so some samples may be discarded.
After creating an instance of the ADCListener class, this class instance has to be passed as a parameter to the ADC.addListener method. After that, the callback methods will be called by the runtime system at the intervals in which new samples are available, but not faster as every second. If the sampling interval is faster multiple values come with one callback.

Example 

   ADC adc = new ADC(0,100);              // sampling interval of 100ms will give you around 10
                                          // sample values in one callback   
   Listener listener = new Listener();        
   adc.addListener(listener);

   ....

 class Listener implements ADCListener {
        
     public void adcValues(int[] values) {

         System.out.println("\r\nListener: number of vals " + values.length); 
        
         for(int i=0; i<values.length; i++)
         {
            System.out.println("\r\n"+ i +"value is " + values[i] + " mV");                     
         }
     }
 }

See Also:
ADC

Method Summary
 void adcValues(int[] values)
          Callback method for ADC sampled values.
 

Method Detail

adcValues

public void adcValues(int[] values)
Callback method for ADC sampled values. Any integer value returned by this callback contains one or more voltage values in mV in the order as they were measured. Range of a value is -25 to 2425.

See Also:
ADC, ADC.addListener(com.siemens.icm.io.ADCListener)
